meanings.definition: A shaft used for transmitting power between a driving shaft and a driven shaft.
meanings.sent1: The jackshaft efficiently transfers power from one shaft to another.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic replaced the worn-out jackshaft in the engine.
meanings.sent3: The jackshaft decided it was tired of being in the middle and wanted to be the main shaft for a change.
meanings.sent4: The jackshaft was the unsung hero, silently moving power where it was needed.
meanings.sent5: The shiny jackshaft gleamed in the dimly lit machinery room, silently doing its job.

meanings.definition: A shaft that supports gears or pulleys for a machine.
meanings.sent1: The jackshaft held the gears firmly in place, ensuring smooth operation.
meanings.sent2: The factory worker greased the jackshaft to prevent any squeaking noises.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the jackshaft for a tree branch and tried to climb it.
meanings.sent4: The jackshaft was the backbone of the machine, supporting all the moving parts.
meanings.sent5: The old jackshaft creaked under the weight of the heavy pulleys, but it never gave up.

meanings.definition: A shaft that connects two or more parts of a machine.
meanings.sent1: The jackshaft linked the engine to the wheels, allowing the car to move.
meanings.sent2: The engineer designed a sturdy jackshaft to ensure the machine's stability.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat thought the jackshaft was a perfect scratching post.
meanings.sent4: The jackshaft was like a bridge, connecting different sections of the machine seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The intricate network of gears relied on the jackshaft to keep everything in sync.
